Full_feature_description: Exponential fit to successive distances in two-dimensional embedding space
Longest sequence of consecutive values in the time-series with succesive decreases

Description: Longest streak of values above mean
Full_feature_description: Longest sequence of successive values in the time-series that are above than the mean
Mode of the z-scored distribution based on ten-bin histogram
Mode of the z-scored distribution based on five-bin histogram

Description: Proportion of values greater than 4% of SD
Full_feature_description: Proportion of difference magnitudes that are greater than 4% of the standard deviation of the time series
First time-lag at which the autocorrelation function drops below 1/e (~0.3679), capturing the approximate scale of the autocorrelation
First local minimum of the autocorrelation function
Mutual information as a nonlinear correlation metric, evaluated from a histogram with five bins at time delay T=2

Time-reversibility statistic, defined as ⟨(xt+1−xt)3⟩t; a value close to zero indicates that positive changes are equal in magnitude to negative changes; a large positive value indicates that positive changes are larger in magnitude than negative changes; and a large negative value indicates that negative changes are larger in magnitude than positive changes.
First local minimum of the automutual information function

Description: First peak in ACF after detrending time series
Full_feature_description: First peak in the autocorrelation function after detrending the time-series with a single-knot cubic regression spline, described in Wang et al. (2007)

Description: Total power in lowest frequency quintile
Full_feature_description: Total power in the lowest 20% of frequencies in the Fourier power spectrum; a high value indicates the time-series has most power in its lower frequencies and a low value indicates the time-series has most power in its higher frequencies

The centroid frequency value in the Fourier power spectrum; a high value indicates the time-series has most of its power in high frequencies, while a low value indicates the time-series is slow-varying with most power in lower frequencies.

Proportion of slower timescale fluctuations that scale with detrended fluctuation analysis (DFA) after downsampling the time series by a factor of 2; a low value means the time series scaling regime changes at shorter timescales, while a higher value means the time series scaling regime changes at longer timescales.

Proportion of slower timescale fluctuations that scale with linearly rescaled range fits; a low value means the time series scaling regime changes at shorter timescales, while a higher value means the time series scaling regime changes at longer timescales.
Ratio of the autocorrelation functions for the original time series and its 1-point incremental differences
Mean error (standard deviation) from a rolling three-sample mean forecasting

Median time interval between successive extreme events below the mean; a value closer to -1 indicates that extreme negative values are clustered toward the beginning of the time series, while a value closer to 1 indicates that extreme negative values are clustered toward the end of the time series

Median time interval between successive extreme events above the mean; a value closer to -1 indicates that extreme positive values are clustered toward the beginning of the time series, while a value closer to 1 indicates that extreme positive values are clustered toward the end of the time series
Shannon entropy of the frequency of two-letter patterns in a three-letter discretization of the time series
Trace of covariance of transition matrix between symbols in a three-letter discretization of the time series
